titleStmt.title: John H. Kennedy to James F. Robinson
CWG8953

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner John H Kennedy would respectfully represent that at the August Term of the Garrard Circuit Court 1863 an indictment was found against him by the Grand Jury of said County for Keeping a Tippling house, upon the evidence of Mr. Dollens who stated before the Jury that he went to the store house of said Kennedy and purchased from John F Cake who was acting temporarily as a clerk of said Kennedy and purchased a pint of whiskey of sd Cake or about that quantity of said Cake and upon that evidence the indictment was fined -- He (Kennedy) upon learning the fact came forward and confessed Judgment in the sum of $20. with costs. -- Your petitioner states that he is a merchant and has license to sell spirits by the q in quantities not less than a quart -- that this sale by Cake to Dollens was made in his absence and without his knowledge or consent and contrary to his practice. He therefore respectfully requests your excellency to remit said fine except the legal costs & fees.

I Michael Owsley Attorney for the commonwealth hereby certify that Wm Dollens was the only witness before the Grand Jury upon whose evidence the indictment against the petitioner John H Kennedy was found and that his evidence is correctly stated in the within petition Aug 22 d 1863

M. H, Owsley.
Atty. for the Comlth

Jno. H. Kennedy
Pettn
No good ground to remit
